components.description:
A cartoon-styled bomb, depicted as a black ball with a burning fuse.

Commonly used for various figurative bombs or explosions, e.g., slang bomb, a “home run” in baseball or softball; "excellent" or "attractive." Sometimes applied in contexts of war, weapons, or violence.

Earlier designs from SoftBank and au by KDDI animated the bomb as exploding.
components.title: Bomb

description:
A cartoon-styled bomb, depicted as a black ball with a burning fuse.

Commonly used for various figurative bombs or explosions, e.g., slang bomb, a “home run” in baseball or softball; "excellent" or "attractive." Sometimes applied in contexts of war, weapons, or violence.

Earlier designs from SoftBank and au by KDDI animated the bomb as exploding.
title: Bomb

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Comic style symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A bomb, with a lit fuse. This means it is soon to explode. Bomb was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.  http://emojipedia.org/bomb/
emoji_net_data.name: bomb

bn:00100895a: Involving or causing danger or risk; liable to hurt or harm
Risky, dangerous, with the nature of a hazard.

bn:00083678v: Cause to burst with a violent release of energy

bn:00083756v: Throw bombs at or attack with bombs
To attack something with bombs, artillery shells or other missiles or projectiles.
To attack by using one or more bombs.
To attack using one or more bombs; to bombard.

bn:00011468n: An explosion is a rapid increase in volume and release of energy in an extreme manner, usually with the generation of high temperatures and the release of gases.
A violent release of energy caused by a chemical or nuclear reaction

A violent, sudden release of energy resulting from powders or gases undergoing instantaneous ignition or from some other means of detonation, often accompanied by a force producing great amounts of heat, major structural damages, shock waves and flying shrapnel.
A rapid increase in volume and release of energy in an extreme manner
Sudden release of energy through high temperatures and gas expansion
A violent release of energy (sometimes mechanical, nuclear, or chemical.)

bn:00011917n: Bombs are any of a range of explosive weapons that only rely on the exothermic reaction of an explosive material to provide an extremely sudden and violent release of energy.
An explosive device fused to explode under specific conditions
A bomb is any of a range of explosive weapons that only rely on the exothermic reaction of an explosive material to provide an extremely sudden and violent release of energy.
An explosive device used or intended as a weapon.
A device filled with explosives used for destroying things.

bn:00001082n: The calculated use of violence, or the threat of violence, against civilians or property to coerce or intimidate governments or societies in order to attain goals that are political or religious or ideological in nature.

The calculated use of violence (or the threat of violence) against civilians in order to attain goals that are political or religious or ideological in nature; this is done through intimidation or coercion or instilling fear
The deliberate commission of an act of violence to create an emotional response through the suffering of the victims in the furtherance of a political or social agenda.
Use of terror as a means of coercion.
This page is for quotes on the subject of Terrorism.
In the international community, terrorism has no legally binding, criminal law definition.
Use of violence as a form of coercion
